User attempts to navigate and perform actions within a workspace in New Expensify 2. User switches to Expensify Classic, where no restriction is present 3. User switches back to New Expensify, and the restriction message persists ## Expected Result: The user should be able to navigate and perform actions normally in the workspace. Workspace restriction status should be consistent between Classic and New Expensify. ## Actual Result: User sees the error message: “Actions on the [workspace name] workspace are currently restricted. Please reach out to your workspace admin with any questions.” Workspace actions are blocked only in New Expensify. ## Workaround: Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround? ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.10-6
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @abbagail
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770076977759929)

## Action Performed:

1. In Expensify Classic, configure a custom export column to use the formula:{expense:posted:M/dd/yyyy}
2. Save this format as Expense Report Review export
3. In New Expensify (NewDot), go to the Reports page
4. Select several expenses in a report that should have a Posted Date
5. Click on the dropdown of the bulk select
6. Click Export to → Expense Report Review using the custom format
7. Open the resulting CSV file
## Expected Result:
The Posted Date column (e.g., Column A) is populated for all applicable expenses/reports, matching the behavior when exporting the same data and format from Expensify Classic.
## Actual Result:
In the CSV exported from New Expensify, most of Column A (the Posted Date column) is blank or missing values.
Exporting the same reports using the same custom export in Expensify Classic populates the Posted Date correctly without any issues.
## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Join as new user & create new workspace 3. Go to workspace chat 4. Create a manual expense >> Submit & approve the expense 5. Create one more expense 6. Go to Reports >> Expenses 7. Select the expense via checkbox which has Pay option 8. Select Pay >> Pay with business account 9. Validate the account & close the RHP 10. Select again Pay dropdown >> Mark as Paid ## Expected Result: Expense should be paid when selecting Mark as Paid option via Pay dropdown in Reports page ## Actual Result: -Mark as paid option via Pay dropdown opens bank account flow ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b18a8a9c-7f30-4b84-a3a0-cb5eb1ace3da [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @jamesdeanexpensify 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1769530805620579)
 
## Action Performed:

1. Create an expense by uploading a receipt and start SmartScanning it
2. Before the scan completes, manually change the amount on the expense
3. Observe the system message indicating that the amount was manually updated by the user
4. Wait for the receipt scan to finish
5. Reopen or refresh the expense and check the amount

## Expected Result:
The manually entered amount should be persisted and remain as the final amount on the expense after scanning completes. The scan should not overwrite or ignore a user‑confirmed manual change.
## Actual Result:
Even though the system message confirms that the amount was manually changed while the receipt was scanning, the final expense amount does not reflect the manual edit and remains unchanged.
## Workaround:
Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-25
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80948
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjosdjnosjnsodnjsoi@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Create two workspaces - A and B.
- Workspace A has per diem rates.
- Do not enable per diem feature on workspace B.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat A.
3. Create a per diem expense.
4. Open the per diem expense.
5. Click More > Change workspace.
6. Select workspace B.
7. After moving per diem report to workspace B, create one more expense (any expense) in the same report.
8. Select the per diem expense via checkbox.
9. Click dropdown button > Move expense.
10. Click Create report.

## Expected Result:
The per diem expense will be moved to a new report.

## Actual Result:
The per diem expense cannot be moved to a new report after changing workspace.
It disappears from the original report and reappears.
A new empty report is created in workspace chat B.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** poipio514+n1@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** iPhone 13 / iOS 18.7.1
**App Component:** Chat Report View

## Action Performed:
Preconditions: 
- logged in to validated gmail account
- account has at least 2 collect workspaces (1 as invited WS, 1 as created WS)

Steps:
1. Navigate to the created workspace chat
2. Create two expenses
3. Open the expense report
4. Open any expense
5. Tap More > Duplicate
6. Use arrows on the top right to navigate to the duplicated expense.
7. Tap app back button to the expense report
8. Tap back again until landed to LHN / inbox tab
9. Navigate to the invited WS chat in precondition

## Expected Result:
- In step 5, Duplicated expense can be navigated via arrows
- In step 6, Duplicated expense should be displayed in the current expense report
- In step 9, The recent duplicated expense shouldn't auto moved to another workspace

## Actual Result:
- In step 5, Duplicated expense cannot be navigated via arrows because it's not displayed in expense report
- In step 6, Duplicated expense isn't displayed in the current expense report, also checking to the WS chat it's not displayed as well
- In step 9, the recent duplicated expense automatically moved to another workspace

## Workaround:
Unknown

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @situchan</details>

title: [$250] Separate out `Accounting` section on `Reports` page into distinct sections

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: HelpDot
labels.description: Apply this label if the issue relates to ExpensifyHelp

body:
We have a very powerful set of accounting workflows that we enable in the app, though using these sections requires knowing how to use advanced social filters. Once we explain the functionality to users, they're blown away by the functionality. So to lower the barrier to using and understanding these features, we're going to split each accounting workflow into it's own section. The structure and logic works like this. **1. Card statements** ------ - This was previously called `Statements` within the accounting section. - Within this section, we'll have sub-options for each card feed that appears in the `Feed` filter. So for example, if the feed name is "ExpensiCorp Visa" then that's what appears. An example to hopefully make this more clear: - Card statements - ExpensiCorp Visa - American Express - Bank of America The benefit of this change is that it's easy to see and toggle between card feeds, even if you're not an expert in filters. **2. Unapproved accruals** ------ - This was previously called "Unapproved cash" and "Unapproved card" - Within this section, we'll have sub-options for "Cash" and then one for each card feed feed. An example to hopefully make this more clear: - Unapproved accruals - Cash - ExpensiCorp Visa - American Express The benefit of this change is similar. Now it's easy to switch between the main cases in the LHN, falling back on the advanced filters only if needed. **3. Bank reconciliation** ------ - The was previously called "Reconciliation" - Within this section, we'll have sub-options for "Reimbursements" and "Expensify Card" (depending on which case exists. An example of hopefully make this more clear: - Bank reconciliation - Reimbursements - Expensify Card

**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80624
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** iPhone SE 3rd gen, iOS 26.2.1
**App Component:** Notifications

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:
- The device has sound enabled and the volume is set high enough.
- App notifications enabled.

1. Open the app.
2. Tap Account > Preferences.
3. Toggle on 'Mute all sounds from Expensify'.
4. Sign in on another device and send a message to the main account.

## Expected Result:
When the 'Mute all sounds from Expensify' toggle is on, no sounds should play when receiving a message.

## Actual Result:
Even with the 'Mute all sounds from Expensify' toggle on, sounds still play after receiving a message.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome | iPhone SE 3rd generation, iOS 26.2.1
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Issue 1:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Track and budget expenses'
5. Enter any name, click Continue
6. In 'Stay organized with a workspace' page, click Create workspace
7. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Set up categories' task

Issue 2:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Manage my team's expenses' > 1-10 employees > QBD > Continue
5. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Invite your team' task

Issue 3:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/
2. Sign up with a Gmail address that includes a +
3. In 'What's your work email?' page, click Skip
4. Select 'Manage my team's expenses' > 1-10 employees > None
5. In 'What features are you interested in?' select all features, then click Continue
6. Click on Inbox, navigate to Concierge, then click 'Set up tags' task (video is shown)
7. Return back to Concierge chat, open 'Set up categories' and 'Invite your team' tasks (video is shown).

## Expected Result:
No video should be shown in the task.

## Actual Result:
The old onboarding video is displayed in the 'Set up categories', 'Invite your team' and 'Set up tags' tasks.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: [$250] [Performance] Attachments/images load extremely slowly when viewing in the app

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Hot Pick
labels.description: Ready for an engineer to pick up and run with

body:
## Problem Attachments and images load very slowly when viewing them in the app, with reports of nearly a minute to load a single low-resolution image even on fast internet connections. ### Observations - On mobile (iOS), loading a single attachment can take ~1 minute for a low-res image - Web loads faster than mobile, but still slower than expected for a responsive application - User's internet is fast and everything else loads fine - The issue is reproducible and was observed by multiple team members during Onshore ## Suspected Cause The attachment carousel feature may be preloading all images in the chat to enable the `<` and `>` navigation arrows. For chats with many attachments, this means: 1. Opening one image triggers loading of potentially dozens/hundreds of other images 2. This causes significant delays before the requested image is visible 3. Large/active chats are disproportionately affected ## Expected Behavior - The selected attachment should load within 1-2 seconds on a decent internet connection - If carousel preloading is needed, it should happen lazily/progressively after the primary image is loaded - Adjacent images (prev/next) could be prioritized over distant ones ## Reproduction Steps 1. Open a chat with many attachments/images 2. Tap on an attachment to view it in the full-screen viewer 3. Observe the loading spinner duration ## Platform - [x] iOS (primary report) - [ ] Android (needs verification) - [x] Web (also affected but less severe) ## Related Discussion Slack thread: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1770083248855669 ## Possible Solutions 1. **Lazy carousel loading**: Only preload adjacent images (N-1, N+1) initially, then progressively load others 2. **Show image immediately**: Display the requested image first, then load carousel images in background 3. **Thumbnail fallback**: Show low-res thumbnails for carousel navigation while full-res images load on demand 4. **Limit preload count**: Cap the number of images preloaded for the carousel
